alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 1:01PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Gulf, south central Liberty and Franklin Counties through 145 PM EDT/1245 PM CDT/... At 101 PM EDT/1201 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles southeast of Wewahitchka to 6 miles west of Apalachicola to 16 miles southwest of St George Island. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St George Island, Eastpoint, Apalachicola, Franklin, Buck Siding, Morgan Place, Royal Bluff, High Bluff, Tilton, Beverly, Green Point, Owens Bridge, Bay City, Sumatra, Howard Creek, Willis Landing, Apalachicola Airport, Twin Pole, Creels and Hays Place. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty
